channel.title: CVE Feed for WPBlockArt -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for WPBlockArt -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-9218|2024-10-02T17:13:54.189Z -- wpblockart -- magazine%20blocks%20%E2%80%93%20blog%20designer%2C%20magazine%20%26%20newspaper%20website%20builder%2C%20page%20builder%20with%20posts%20blocks%2C%20post%20grid
item.description: The Magazine Blocks – Blog Designer, Magazine & Newspaper Website Builder, Page Builder with Posts Blocks, Post Grid plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting due to the use of add_query_arg without appropriate escaping on the URL in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.14. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-35704|2024-08-02T03:14:53.844Z -- wpblockart -- blockart%20blocks
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WPBlockArt BlockArt Blocks allows Stored XSS.This issue affects BlockArt Blocks: from n/a through 2.1.5.

item.title: CVE-2024-34760|2024-06-04T17:41:40.063Z -- wpblockart -- magazine%20blocks
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WPBlockart Magazine Blocks allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Magazine Blocks: from n/a through 1.3.6.

item.title: CVE-2024-9218|2024-10-02T08:31:51.008Z -- wpblockart -- magazine%20blocks%20%E2%80%93%20blog%20designer%2C%20magazine%20%26%20newspaper%20website%20builder%2C%20page%20builder%20with%20posts%20blocks%2C%20post%20grid
item.description: The Magazine Blocks – Blog Designer, Magazine & Newspaper Website Builder, Page Builder with Posts Blocks, Post Grid plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting due to the use of add_query_arg without appropriate escaping on the URL in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.14. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
